attributes.action: Affirm and protect trans rights, respect GRA reform consultation results
attributes.additional_details:
Access to NHS gender services already has multi-year waiting lists (http://tiny.cc/x0btqz). Any further restriction on trans healthcare is inhumane.

We are behind other countries who have successfully introduced self-ID e.g. Argentina (http://tiny.cc/cjbtqz) and Ireland (http://tiny.cc/dhbtqz)

Independent article on the expected negative impact of these proposals: http://tiny.cc/zcbtqz

Times article that initially reported the expected government consultation response: http://tiny.cc/ifbtqz
attributes.background:
Recognize that the consultation responses reflect public opinion on self-ID, and that it is unacceptable to ignore 70%+ support for Gender Recognition Act reform.

Not further restrict trans rights, access to gender-appropriate public spaces and toilets, or transition-related healthcare.

rejection.details:
Reform the Gender Recognition Act: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/327108

Uphold current legal protections for transgender individuals and under 18s:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/318175

Do not ban gender transition treatments for under 18s:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/318025

Add gender identity to the characteristics protected under the Equality Act 2010:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/301138

Require schools and colleges to have gender neutral toilets:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/302997

Introduce Gender and Race equity for GCSE English Literature set texts:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324934

Allow for a gender neutral option on a passport, such as an "X":
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/301083
